title: Equations of Rotation
text: The equations of rotation are $$x=x'cos(\theta)-y'sin(\theta)$$ and $$y=\operatorname{x'sin}\left(\theta\right)+\operatorname{x'cos}\left(\theta\right)$$

title: Plugging in the Angle
text: Because $$\theta=45$$, plug in the value into the equations of rotation for $$x$$ and $$y$$. Simplify so you are left with an algebraic function (with no trignometric functions)

title: Algebraic Simplifications
text: Using FOIL method, combining like terms, and other simplifications, determine the new representation of the equation. Write the answer so that there are no fractions.
